text: I can't help but feel bad for Conker. He only got 2 games! Donkey Kong got a few and even Banjo-Kazooie got 5! Conker only had 2. Conker's Pocket Tales, and Conker's Bad Fur Day. Live & Reloaded doesn't count because it's a ramake, Project Spark is a game that got Conker slapped on it so it would sell better (Conker's not even in the main game!) and Young Conker is an augmented reality game (doesn't count. I'm only counting MAIN games). Hell if you think about it.... Donkey Kong came back with Returns and Tropical Freeze. Banjo came back with the spiritual successor with Yooka-Laylee. What does Conker get? Stuck in Microsoft hell with no bright light in his immediate future. No spiritual successor, no comeback/sequel, nothing he's just dead, probably for good. I mean I know he doesn't have the following that say Banjo or Mario had/have but damn it he's still a great character and had an awesome game. He never got his chance to shine, he never got the chance to make something of himself, he has the two games and that's it. He didn't get half the screen time or credit he deserved. Hell there would've been a Conker's Other Bad Fur Day if Microsoft didn't cancel it. They had a story and everything! And instead he's just.......... gone. Really makes you sympathize with the poor critter.

author: PunkRock Loser90

text:
There were plenty of games before this one to be rated M, but this one is definitely significant for other reasons. I think it was the first game in this genre to be rated M. 3D platformers at that time were typically family friendly, and even today they don't usually go past a T rating (if even that).

I also think the content behind the M rating might be responsible for its controversy. Nintendo was fine with having other M-rated games on the N64 (Perfect Dark, Turok, etc.), but those earned their rating from violence. Conker was a lot more raunchy, with things like the sunflower and Buga the Knut.

text: Also, I feel that they didn't hit bulls-eye with all of the different gameplay mechanics they tried to incorporate. While I really enjoyed some of them, I can name a few that felt semi-broken, such as the bull riding and lava surfing. It's actually one of the most frustrating games I've ever played. It's a good thing it doesn't count how many times you die. In fact, I can name at least ten parts of the game that frustrated the hell out of me, whether or not they were well-designed.
author: lukerbom12

text: It is pretty short, but I have more problems with the game than that.  I just feel that it was too "scattery." You didn't have any permanent power ups, just temporary ones for different situation. I get that that's what some people like, but I like it better in Banjo and DK where you keep getting more moves as you go. Also, it's not that the worlds weren't wide open...they were just too small and you never really got to enjoy one place for a while. Again, I get that some people like that.
author: lukerbom12

text: Fair enough we all have our own opinions on different games. My only real complaint with this game is it's to short for my liking (once you know what you're doing you can finish it within 9 hours) but either way this is in my opinion rares best game.

text: Well, thank you, and that's great for you.
author: lukerbom12

text: I do like the game, but after seeing the praise it got and then playing it myself, I think it's kind of overrated, and I consider it one of Rare's worst games on the N64 (and don't take that too harshly. They made so many amazing games that one that is simply 'pretty good' can be considered the worst for me.) That is my honest opinion. If any of you diehard fans feel you need to take shots at me...well, I can understand. Just try to be respectful and open-minded.
author: lukerbom12

text: I see what he means about it being rushed. The controls are fine and the gameplay has a lot of variety, so maybe it's not as much rushed as it is that some areas didn't receive some attention that was needed. The world is kind of pseudo-wide open as there seems to be a lot to explore, but there really isn't. It's hard to explain. Also, some parts were poorly done. Most of the difficulty was fair but I can think of some cheap parts. Thank god they put in a lot of checkpoints.
